channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report E-2023100543
item.description:
Report E-2023100543

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-23T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-08
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 8, 2023, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1487 was damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The impacted bag was patched with tape for continued processing and shipping. Crews utilized hand tools to collect and containerize the free-standing material into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023091003
item.description:
Report X-2023091003

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-20T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. Upon being found, the leaking package was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The cap on one of the bottles was loose and the contents began to leak out. Due to the content's corrosive nature, the contents began to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were placed in a spill tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023090880
item.description:
Report X-2023090880

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler dropped the plastic drum causing its top to wedge open and spill. We cleaned up the spill with neutralizer. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Top wedged open due to being dropped DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Top was secured back on and package was placed in a lined red tote.
